dmca.title: Dark Knight on the prowl for linked images
dmca.body:
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Dear Digg.com,

I am writing this letter on behalf of Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. ("Warner Bros."), in response to the discovery of copyrighted works from Warner Bros.'  Your website is offering images from THE DARK KNIGHT, consisting of the Batman and Joker character. I have a good faith belief that such content is not authorized by Warner Bros., its agent, or the law and therefore infringes Warner Bros.' rights. 

Images to be removed are located at:

http://digg.com/movies/FIRST_PICTURE_OF_TWO_FACE_FROM_THE_DARK_KNIGHT
http://digg.com/movies/SPOILER_What_Two_Face_looks_like
http://digg.com/movies/Leaked_Two_Face_production_art_from_Dark_Knight


I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed. 
Please confirm that you have taken the appropriate action at your earliest convenience. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter and please advise should you have any questions or require any additional information. 

Thank you,

Sincerely, 

David Kaplan

David Kaplan
VP,Worldwide Anti-Piracy Enforcement
4000 Warner Blvd.
Burbank, CA  91522
818.954.3091



-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: 8.0

iD8DBQFIIL2FVWIgYlLUg0IRAqTCAKCJHVnNum/12rfWBmcDk+grJ1vO7gCgoPAx
tS1ARm+8fmSbHWcg44HqPeY=
=nfF9
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
